Detailed Description

Is used to unescape an input string.

This class is provided for help constructing internal processing functions. It is not typically used. Consider CSplitBlob for retrieving elements of a string blob.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CUnescapeString::CUnescapeString ( const TCHAR *  szString,
TCHAR  tcEscape 
) [inline]

Unescapes the input string.

The constructor builds a buffer (if necessary) to contain the string after all the escape sequences for tabs/newlines have been removed.

Parameters:
szStringis the string to unescape.
tcEscapeis the escape character.

A static function that counts the number of escape sequences that need to be reversed.

Parameters:
sis the input string.
eis the escape character.

The number of escape sequences that need to be reversed.

static void CUnescapeString::UnescapeString ( const TCHAR *  s,
TCHAR *  d,
TCHAR  e 
) [inline, static]

Unescapes the source string to the destination string.

Parameters:
sis the source string.
dis the destination string. This must be large enough to contain the unescaped version of the source string.
eis the escape character.
